paper_title.en: EFFECT ON BRAIN ACTIVITY OF CLOTHING PRESSURE BY WAIST BELTS
paper_title.ja: Effect on Brain Activity of Clothing Pressure by Waist Belts.

paper_title.en: Effect on Brain Activity of Clothing Pressure by Waist Belts.
Effect of Acetyl Content on Sorption Isotherm of Water by Chitosan.
Effect of polymer chain end on sorption isotherm of water by chitosan

description.en: In this study, the sorption isotherms of water vapor by chitosans with various molecular weights were measured. The BET adsorption theory was modified for the system that has several different kinds of energy levels in the water adsorption sites, i.e. a hydroxyl group, an amino group, the polymer chain end, etc, and applied it to the experimental results in order to examine the effect of the polymer chain end on the sorption isotherm of water-chitosan using the parameters which represented the total number of adsorption sites, V-m, the interaction energy between water and the adsorption sites, K, and the number of adsorbed layers, n. V-m and K increased as the molecular weight decreased, and n remained constant. It has been proved that the increase in V-m and K were caused by the hydrophilic groups in the polymer chain end. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Evaluation of thermesthesia for wearing by using chaotic analysis of EEG

description.en: Thermesthesia in clothes wearing is the important element which gives influence to a comfortable feeling by wearing clothes. Sensory test or physical properties of clothes has been used for evaluation of thermesthesia in clothes wearing. We propose a evaluation method of thermesthesia by using physiological response for the purpose of evaluating thermesthesia objectively. Electroencephalogram (EEG) is used as a physiological response far wearing. Using chaotic analysis, the complicacy of EEG is expressed quantitatively by the correlation dimension. We studied the relation between subjective thermesthesia and dynamics of EEG for the purpose of investigating effect of the evaluation of thermesthesia for wearing by using of chaotic analysis of EEG. As a result, under the comfortable condition with coat, EEG shows deterministic chaos. On the other hand, under the stress condition without coat, EEG shows weak chaos. Correlation dimension of EEG was higher with coat than without one. These results suggest that chaotic analysis of EEG is effective to the quantitative evaluation of thermesthesia.

paper_title.ja: 動画像解析によるファウンデーションの歪み分布計測
paper_title.en: Distributed Strain Measurement of Foundation Garments Using Motion Image Analysis

description.ja: This paper discusses a measurement for strain distribution on girdles using motion image analysis. The proposed method allows dynamic measuremertt of the strain distribution by non-contact measurement that does not affect subjects. In order to evaluate the strain distribution on the girdles, the methods of calculating tensile strain, shear strain and rotation by discrete displacement vector fields are explained. In experiments, we observe that a subject wearing the girdle drawn grid pattern raises the left leg. Grid pattern deformation provides discrete displacement vector fields, so that tensile strain and shear strain are obtained. Principal strain calculated by tensile strain and shear strain on the girdle shows changes of strain distribution after raising a leg. Consequently, it is confirmed that the girdle at the waist is strained when the subject starts to raise the left leg.
description.en: This paper discusses a measurement for strain distribution on girdles using motion image analysis. The proposed method allows dynamic measuremertt of the strain distribution by non-contact measurement that does not affect subjects. In order to evaluate the strain distribution on the girdles, the methods of calculating tensile strain, shear strain and rotation by discrete displacement vector fields are explained. In experiments, we observe that a subject wearing the girdle drawn grid pattern raises the left leg. Grid pattern deformation provides discrete displacement vector fields, so that tensile strain and shear strain are obtained. Principal strain calculated by tensile strain and shear strain on the girdle shows changes of strain distribution after raising a leg. Consequently, it is confirmed that the girdle at the waist is strained when the subject starts to raise the left leg.

paper_title.ja: 綿および麻を素材とした下刈用作業服の試作と衣服内気候の実験的検討
林業用雨具の衣服内気候
下刈作業時における新素材作業服の衣内気候
paper_title.en: Temperature under clothing using new materials while brush cutting.

description.ja: 新素材の作業服として,今回,綿・ポリエステル高次複重層糸織物の作業服Aと,アクリル極細繊維編物の作業服Bを下刈作業服に用いた場合の衣内気候について検討を行った。衣内温度,絶対湿度の変化の全体的な傾向は外気の黒球温度のそれに一致していた。作業服Aは,多量の発汗が生じたときは通気性が阻害され,衣内湿度が高くなっていた。作業服Bは吸水率が高くて通気性もよいが,汗で完全に濡れた場合には熱伝導率が大きくなる。作業服A,Bは本来,通常の屋外での着心地を重視した開発意図によるものであり,多量の発汗には適応しきれなかったが,例えば曇りで風があるときや,晴れていても湿度が低く,風があるときのように,風,湿度等の条件がそろえば,蒸散によって身体を冷やし,その機能を発揮することができるものと思われる。
description.en: Research on temperature under clothing using new materials while brush cutting was conducted. Two types of shirts were studied. One is a textile of yarn consisting of multi-layers of cotton and polyestel (worker's shirt A), and the other is a fine acrylic fiber knit (worker's shirt B). Temperature and absolute humidity under clothing were related to the temperature of the black bulb thermometer in the atmosphere. When perspiring, shirt A's permeability was obstructed, and the humidity increased. Shirt B has high levels of water absorption and permeability, but the thermal conductivity increased with an increase in perspiration. Shirts A and B were developed to improve comfortableness under ordinary outdoor conditions. Their shirts could not be fitted for high levels of pirspiration. However, the shirts will be able to display functions in cooling the body temperature through transpiration in cloudy and windy conditions or in low humidity and windy weather.

publication_name.en: Journal of The Japan Forest Engineering Society

paper_title.ja: 水冷ベストの下刈作業への適用
三次元人体測定データからの原型作成システム
換気孔を有する冬季林業用作業服の試作とタワーヤーダ荷掛け作業への適用
paper_title.en: Design of forestry-worker's winter clothes with slits for ventilation and applied tests for a mobile tower-yarder operator

description.ja: 作業時には衣服内温度と湿度の上昇や発汗を抑制し,休憩時や衣服内温湿度が低いときには体を冷やさないように,衣服内温湿度を調節できる冬季林業用作業服を設計・試作した。すなわち,作業服に開閉できる換気孔を設け,保温の必要なときには換気孔を閉じ保温性を持たせ,発汗が生じるような状態では換気孔を開け,換気による熱移動を促進するようにした。換気孔は背部に縦型に開けたが,1列のものと2列のものの2種類試作した。さらに,試作作業服を用いて,1名の被験者に,寒冷地におけるタワーヤーダ集材の荷掛け作業に適用し,衣服内気候の調節機能や実際の現場での着衣感覚について検討を行った。いずれの作業服も,換気孔を閉じた状態では衣服内相対湿度が80%RHを超えたが,背部換気孔の開口によって,最内層の湿度は低下し,低い状態を保持した。作業服内側の空気層の温度は5〜8℃の低下が生じたが,最内層の温度低下は最小に抑えることができた。着心地に関する被験者の聞き取り調査においても,換気孔の開閉により快適な状態が保たれていることが示された。
description.en: We designed and produced forestry-worker's clothes that adjust the temperature and humidity inside. The work clothes have slits which can be opened and closed. When workers feel hot and began to perspire while working, they can open the slits to facilitate ventilation and prevent increases in temperature and humidity. When they feel cold and thermal insulation is necessary while resting, they are kept warm by closing the slits. We produced two styles of clothes. Both have vertical slits in the back. One has two slits in the back and the other has one slit in the center of the back. Using these clothes, applied tests were carried out during the loading operation of a mobile tower-yarder in a cold field. The climate inside the clothes and the worker's sensation of the clothes were examined. Although the humidity inside both styles of clothes was more than 80% RH when working with the slit closed, the humidity of the innermost layer decreased and stayed low after opening the slits. A decrease of 5 to 8℃ was recorded in the temperatures of the second layer of the work clothes. The decrease in temperature of the innermost layer, however, was kept to a minimum. The results, showing the climate inside the clothes, and the questionnaires about the worker's sensations indicated that comfortable conditions were maintained by opening and closing the slits.
